name: copy-reference-advanced
description: Copies relative/absolute file path with line number(s)

copyReferenceAdvanced.lineOffset.description: The value that will be added to the real (zero-based) line number

copyReferenceAdvanced.pathLineNumberDeli.description: The delimiter for the path and line numbers: [path][DELIMITER][line(s)] e.g. my/file.txt:1-10

copyReferenceAdvanced.lineNumberDelimite.description: The delimiter for the two line numbers e.g. default: [line]-[line]

copyReferenceAdvanced.collapseSingleLine.description: True: when only one line was selected e.g. 16 the output will be 16 without line number delimiter, false: the output will be 16-16 (in case of the default line number delimiter)

copyReferenceAdvanced.prependToPath.description: A string/path that should be prepended to the path

copyReferenceAdvanced.appendToPath.description: A string/path that should be appended to the path

copyReferenceAdvanced.pathMode.description: absolutePaths: use absolute file paths, relativePaths: use paths relative to the open folder (workspace), relativePathsWithoutFolderName: use paths relative to the open folder (workspace) removing the folder name

copyReferenceAdvanced.failIfNoFolderIsOp.description: If 'pathMode' is set to relative and no folder is open... True: notify warning because we cannot get a relative path (noting is copied), false: just copy the absolute path (default: false)

copyReferenceAdvanced.displayCopiedTimeo.description: The duration the copied text should be displayed as status bar item, use a value <= 0 to not display the item

copyReferenceAdvanced.prependToCopiedTex.description: Some text that should be prepended to the whole copied text

copyReferenceAdvanced.appendToCopiedText.description: Some text that should be appended to the whole copied text

copyReferenceAdvanced.prependToLines.description: Some text that should be prepended to the lines text

copyReferenceAdvanced.appendToLines.description: Some text that should be appended to the lines text e.g. L --> 1-10L
